results.title: In search of earthquakes
results.creator_credit: Alex Pomasanoff, Alan Landsburg Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Examines several major earthquakes and summarises the current technology of earthquake prediction. Traces the 500 mile San Andreas fault and shows its definite movements.

results.title: In other words
results.creator_credit: Jan Padgett, George Johnson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: In other words examines the effects of homophobia on gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender teens. Using interviews, animation, music, classroom discussion and dictionary definitions, this documentary aims to demystify homophobic language and to alert the viewer to its harmful effects. Although the documentary covers sophisticated territory, for example the difference between sexuality and gender identity, regular reference to the personal experiences of teenagers gives it clarity and relevancy. “In other words” is suitable for an audience aged 12-18.

results.title: In one day
results.creator_credit: James Carney, George Pearson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A cool, scientific look at weather forecasting, and the drama involved. From far-flung meteorological stations and observation posts, to the weather-plotting station of the Meteorological Station of Canada with its automated mapping machines, this examination of what weather is and how it is anticipated on a world scale makes absorbing viewing. Here, for a change, the weatherman is unquestionably the hero. Written by James Carney. Photography by Paul Leach and Gilles Gascon.Editing by William Brind. Music: Karl Duplessis. Sound by Bernard Bordeleau. (Awards: Columbus; Rome.)

results.title: In old Kentucky
results.brief_description: The American Civil War may divide a family when brothers Robert and George enlist on opposite sides but when one brother finds himself on the run after being captured as a spy, family loyalty comes to the rescue. Cast includes Henry B. Walthall, Owen Moore, Verner Clarges, Kate Bruce, Mary Pickford, Mack Sennett.

results.title: In my room
results.creator_credit: Melissa Juhanson, Film Victoria and Olympus Films
results.brief_description: 3 teenagers speak candidly about their dreams, aspirations, fears and the sanctity that is their bedroom. 17 year old Kirsty lives in St Kilda with her mother, is deciding whether to pursue acting or music, and whether to return to school. Jyka is a 14 year old Koorie boy living in Broadmeadows with his extended family and aspires to move out when he’s 16, learn to read, and become a panel beater. 16 year old Will has moved from the country and is boarding at Melbourne Grammar. With remarkable candour and a palpable trust in the voiceless director, the three share their views on the world as perceived from their bedroom.

results.title: In memory of Mawalan: a ceremony for Wandjuk's father
results.brief_description: In 1971 Wandjuk Marika organised a Djangkawu ceremony at Yirrkala in memory of his father, Mawalan who died in 1967. Mawalan had been the highly respected head of the Rirratjingu clan for whom the Djangkawu are primary creator ancestors. For this film Wandjuk has made explicit only outside or public interpretation of this ceremony. The ceremony was also important for its attempt to reinforce, for tribal members, the importance of their traditions. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: In love cancer
results.creator_credit: Jenny Robertson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An experiment in which traditional narrative is displaced by visions of medication, dismemberment, desire, procreation, transfiguration and fatality. It endorses the imagination, the emotions and the irrational. Winner: Yoram Gross Animation Award, Sydney Film Festival 1987.

results.title: In Love and law (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Pip Karmel, Noel Price and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This video contains a series of three short episodes which examine issues that arise as a result of separation and divorce and offers advice on resolving conflict through counselling. Episode 1. “Calling it a day”, episode 2. “Baby makes three” and episode 3. “House and home”.
